pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Document node stats response meta
pullRequest.bodyText:
Documents several metadata-related parameters returned by the GET _nodes/stats API.
Also adds a note indicated that stats in other sections are keyed by nodes.<node_id>.

commit.message:
[DOCS] Document node stats response meta

Documents several metadata-related parameters returned by the
`GET _nodes/stats` API.

nodes.bodyText: This is actually the timestamp that the node stats were collected for this specific response. Not sure if that's what you were meaning here, but this phrasing made me think this meant more that this was a timestamp of something happening in the background.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -137,6 +137,54 @@ include::{docdir}/rest-api/common-parms.asciidoc[tag=include-segment-file-sizes]
 [[cluster-nodes-stats-api-response-body]]
 ==== {api-response-body-title}
 
+`cluster_name`::
+(string)
+Name of the cluster. Based on the <<cluster.name>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.timestamp`::
+(integer)
+Last time the node statistics were refreshed. Recorded in milliseconds since the

nodes.bodyText: This does not look entirely correct. This is more accurately the address and port for the binary transport layer of the node, not HTTP/S
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -137,6 +137,54 @@ include::{docdir}/rest-api/common-parms.asciidoc[tag=include-segment-file-sizes]
 [[cluster-nodes-stats-api-response-body]]
 ==== {api-response-body-title}
 
+`cluster_name`::
+(string)
+Name of the cluster. Based on the <<cluster.name>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.timestamp`::
+(integer)
+Last time the node statistics were refreshed. Recorded in milliseconds since the
+https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time[Unix Epoch].
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.name`::
+(string)
+Human-readable identifier for the node. Based on the <<node.name>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.transport_address`::
+(string)
+Host and port where HTTP connections for the node are accepted.

nodes.bodyText:
Do we want to break down the attributes like this? From what I can see, these are essentially static values sourced from node configurations (node.attr.<name>), and may either contain more or fewer than these listed attributes.
Even on an Elastic cloud service instance, the attributes are different:
"attributes" : {
  "logical_availability_zone" : "zone-0",
  "server_name" : "instance-XXXXXXXXXX",
  "availability_zone" : "us-central1-a",
  "xpack.installed" : "true",
  "instance_configuration" : "gcp.data.highio.1",
  "region" : "unknown-region"
}
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -137,6 +137,54 @@ include::{docdir}/rest-api/common-parms.asciidoc[tag=include-segment-file-sizes]
 [[cluster-nodes-stats-api-response-body]]
 ==== {api-response-body-title}
 
+`cluster_name`::
+(string)
+Name of the cluster. Based on the <<cluster.name>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.timestamp`::
+(integer)
+Last time the node statistics were refreshed. Recorded in milliseconds since the
+https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time[Unix Epoch].
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.name`::
+(string)
+Human-readable identifier for the node. Based on the <<node.name>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.transport_address`::
+(string)
+Host and port where HTTP connections for the node are accepted.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.host`::
+(string)
+Network host for the node, based on the <<network.host>> setting.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.ip`::
+(string)
+IP address and port for the node.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.roles`::
+(array of strings)
+Roles assigned to the node. See <<modules-node>>.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.attributes.ml.machine_memory`::
+(string)
+Total bytes of memory used for {ml-docs}/index.html[machine learning].
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.attributes.xpack.installed`::
+(string)
+If `true`, X-Pack features are enabled. See <<license-settings>>.
+
+`nodes.<node_id>.attributes.ml.max_open_jobs`::
+(string)
+Maximum number of {ml-docs}/index.html[machine learning] jobs that can run
+simultaneously on the node. Based on the
+<<xpack.ml.max_open_jobs,xpack.ml.max_open_jobs>> setting.
